metadata.title: CVE-2014-8158 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in jpc_qmfb.c in JasPer 1.900.1 andearlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) orpossibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted JPEG 2000 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.2').
